paper_abstract: This paper addresses the problem of global finite-time stabilization by dynamic state feedback for a class of stochastic nonlinear systems. Firstly, we show a dynamic state transformation, under which the original system is transformed into a new system. Then, a state feedback controller with a dynamic gain is designed for the new system. It is shown that global finite-time stabilization in probability for a class of stochastic nonlinear system under linear growth condition can be guaranteed by appropriately choosing design parameters. Finally, a simulation example is provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed design scheme.
paper_title: GLOBAL FINITE-TIME STABILIZATION FOR A CLASS OF STOCHASTIC NONLINEAR SYSTEMS BY DYNAMIC STATE FEEDBACK
